citeinfo.origin: Indiana Department of Transportation, Road Inventory Section
citeinfo.title: FUNCTIONAL_CLASS_INDOTMODEL_IN: Functional Classification of Roadways in Indiana, 2015 (Indiana Department of Transportation, Line Shapefile)

pubinfo.publish: Indiana Department of Transportation, Road Inventory Section

citeinfo.othercit:
In 2004, Bernardin-Lochmueller and Associates (BLA), used the Indiana Statewide Travel Demand Model(ISTDM) files in TransCAD to convert a subset to an ESRI ArcView shapefile. Tables were edited to contain only the fields appropriate for the functional classification subset.
NOTE -- Updated data was provided by INDOT personnel to personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) in an ESRI geodatabase as a line feature class named "FUNC_CLASS" on June 26, 2012.
NOTE -- Updated data was provided by INDOT personnel to personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) in an ESRI geodatabase as a line feature class named "FUNCTIONAL_CLASS" on July 1, 2016.

descript.abstract: FUNCTIONAL_CLASS_INDOTMODEL_IN is a line shapefile that shows the Federal Highway Administration functional classification of roadways from the Road Inventory of the Indiana GIS Department of Transportation (INDOT). The data were derived from pre-existing INDOT basemaps and databases. Functional classification generally is the process by which streets and highways are grouped into classes, or systems, according to the character of the service they are intended to provide year to year. Classifications are "Interstate," "Principal Arterial - Other Freeways or Expressways," "Principal Arterial - Other," "Principal Arterial," "Minor Arterial," "Major Collector," "Minor Collector," and "Local." The data were collected between 2011 and 2015.
descript.purpose: To provide all functional class roadways in Indiana (as maintained by INDOT) in a GIS format.

cntorgp.cntorg: Indiana Department of Transportation, Road Inventory Supervisor (Eric Rader)

attracc.attraccr: This data set was provided by INDOT personnel and is assumed to be accurate.

dataqual.logic: This data set was provided by INDOT personnel and is assumed to be accurate.
dataqual.complete: This data set was provided by INDOT personnel and is assumed to be complete.

horizpa.horizpar: Unknown, however use with high accuracy aerial imagery has shown highway positions to be highly accurate.

citeinfo.title: FUNCTIONAL_CLASS (Esri Line feature class containing all roadways in Indiana with functional classification attributes)

srcinfo.srccontr: All roadways in Indiana with functional classification attributes (current as of December 31, 2015)

procstep.procdesc: The base_2000 file from the Indiana Statewide Travel Demand Model, version 4, (ISTDM4) was converted in TransCAD to an Esri ArcView Shapefile. All roadways in Indiana in the model were included in the subset, however centroid connectors were removed. Numerous attribute fields were removed to result in the basic roadway information.

IGS personnel received an Esri file geodatabase containing a line feature class named "FUNC_CLASS" from INDOT personnel on June 26, 2012. FUNC_CLASS feature class was loaded into ESRI ArcMap and examined for completeness, attribute accuracy, and spatial accuracy. IGS personnel then exported the feature class to an Esri shapefile format named as "FUNCTIONAL_CLASS_INDOTMODEL_IN.SHP".

IGS personnel received an Esri file geodatabase containing a line feature class named "FUNCTIONAL_CLASS" from INDOT personnel on July 1, 2016. FUNCTIONAL_CLASS feature class was loaded into Esri ArcMap and examined for completeness, attribute accuracy, and spatial accuracy. IGS personnel then exported the feature class to an Esri shapefile format named as "FUNCTIONAL_CLASS_INDOTMODEL_IN.SHP".

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attr.attrdef: Text Description of functional class category (Interstate, Principal Arterial - Other Freeways or Expressways, Principal Arterial - Other, Principal Arterial, Minor Arterial, Major Collector, Minor Collector, Local)

distinfo.distliab:
CREDIT
It is requested that the Indiana Department of Transportation be cited in any products generated from this data. The following source citation should be included: [FUNCTIONAL_CLASS_INDOTMODEL_IN: Functional Classification of Roadways in Indiana, 2015 (Indiana Department of Transportation, Line Shapefile), 20161025].
WARRANTY
Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey warrants that the media on which this product is stored will be free from defect in materials and workmanship for ninety (90) days from the date of acquisition. If such a defect is found, return the media to Publication Sales, Indiana Geological Survey, 611 North Walnut Grove, Bloomington, Indiana 47405-2208, and it will be replaced free of charge.
LIMITATION OF WARRANTIES AND LIABILITY
Except for the expressed warranty above, the product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
